description: From Middle English expounden, from Old French espondre, from Latin exponere. Doublet of expose.

verbs.description: expound (third-person singular simple present expounds, present participle expounding, simple past and past participle expounded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To set out the meaning of; to explain or discuss at length
(intransitive) To make a statement, especially at length.
examples: He expounded often on the dangers of the imperial presidency.
